replies.body: I've edited out the name from your post because it was breaking our _'Naming and Shaming'_ rule. You're welcome to talk about any issues on the boards, but just make sure you exclude summoner names next time :D
umm wouldn't it be better to just remove the post completely considering the fact it now has no content?
Many people don't realise "No Naming and Shaming" is a rule, so it serves to increase visibility.

*a bad rule that only helps the toxic players

reworded for ya =)

In many name and shame posts there is no evidence to prove wrongdoing, so they can create witch hunts for innocent players. 

Even where there is evidence presented, it may not be true, or we may not have the full story, which creates the same problem.

Even when there is true and complete evidence, the punishment systems of League are designed to encourage reform, or where that is not possible, to remove players from the community without affecting others, both of which are hindered by naming and shaming. 

For a player that is reforming, being named and shamed will send them back down their negative path. If an account is permabanned, then the naming and shaming only serves to create and hold grudges, which negatively affects those players who have them.

It can be argued there are positives to naming and shaming, but they do not align with the purpose of the punishment system, nor do they outweigh the negatives.
